title: HELSINKI Release
content:
One of the first type designs I made was done during my exchange study in Finland, almost ten years ago. It was inspired by the Finnish traffic sign type and covered only one font. Now I reworked and expanded it to a family, including a extremely thin and fat one.  
Have a look [here.](http://web.archive.org/web/20140718051921/http:/www.ludwiguebele.de/item.php/Typefaces/Display/Helsinki/) There is also a [PDF](http://web.archive.org/web/20140718051921/http:/www.ludwiguebele.de/elements/fontPDF/53/fontPDF.pdf) available.  
Hope you like it.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140718051921im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Helsinki_6039.jpg)
author: ludwiguebele

comments.content: Why does nobody like this font?

i go on my gut – I do like the extremes of it  
the middle doesn't click for me

I like it. Especially the boldest weight. :)

Kind regards,  
Martijn van Berkel
